alert.note: Alert for Andrews; Gaines (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 29 at 8:58PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN LEA...NORTHWESTERN ANDREWS AND WESTERN GAINES COUNTIES THROUGH 1000 PM CDT/900 PM MDT/... At 858 PM CDT/758 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles west of Denver City to near Hobbs to 14 miles southwest of Monument. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Hobbs, Seminole, Eunice, Seagraves, Monument, Humble City, Eunice Airport, Nadine, Gaines County Airport, Knowles, Lea County Regional Airport, Industrial Airpark, Oil Center, Paynes Corner, Higginbotham, and Gaines County Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
